name: find_nearest_characters
example_code: function( character ) return character:get_team() == Team.Red end )
example_comment: The above snippet shows two ways of passing a function to `find_nearest_characters()`.
description: Iterates through all of the <%=character%>s, and returns a list of the closest valid <%=character%>s to a specified <%=character%>.
To *include* a <%=character%> in the final list, the filter `function` has to return `true`.
If it returns `false` for a <%=character%>, it will *not* be included.

parameters.name: search_function
parameters.desc: A filter function that determines if the <%=character%> gets added to the list.

text: Even if a <%=character%> is nearer to the `pivot_character` than others, unless it meets the `search_function` requirements, it will be ignored.
The distance between <%=tile%>s (and by extension, <%=character%>s), is measured using the [Manhattan distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taxicab_geometry)..
`search_function` requires **one** <%=character%> parameter, and to return a `boolean`.
Return `true` for any <%=character%> that you *do* want to include.
Return `false` for any <%=character%> that you *do not* want to include.
_The function does **not** have to be named `search_function`, it is just for illustrative purposes._
footnotes.comment: When used with the above snippet, `find_characters()` returns all <%=character%>s that are currently on the Red team.
